Key Arguments: The legislation poses a threat to democracy, society, and the economy.
The government should not have the authority to decide what is misinformation or disinformation.
The legislation infringes on freedom of speech and expression.
The government has previously been a source of misinformation, particularly during the COVID-19 pandemic.
The legislation could irreparably damage trust between the Australian people and the government.
Notable Quotes: This legislation is an affront to any concept of freedom of speech or expression.
It is Stalinist, authoritarian and an insult to the Australian people.
The Covid debacle showed the government lied. Actual scientific information and the truth were censored.
